Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • Game

  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents the main game logic for a grid-based game. The game involves two players (BLUE and RED) who take turns adding and merging blocks on a grid. The game also includes walls that restrict block movement and merging.

    • Method Detail

      • addBlock

        public boolean addBlock(int row,
                        int col,
                        int value)
        Adds a block to the grid at the specified position with the current player's color.
        Parameters:
        row - The row index of the block.
        col - The column index of the block.
        value - The value of the block.
        Returns:
        True if the block was successfully added, false otherwise.

      • addBlock

        public boolean addBlock(int row,
                        int col,
                        int value,
                        BColor color)
        Adds a block to the grid at the specified position with the specified player's color.
        Parameters:
        row - The row index of the block.
        col - The column index of the block.
        value - The value of the block.
        color - The color of the block.
        Returns:
        True if the block was successfully added, false otherwise.

      • check

        public java.util.ArrayList<Block> check(java.util.ArrayList<Block> blocks,
                                        Direction dir)
        Processes a list of blocks and merges them according to the game rules.
        Parameters:
        blocks - The list of blocks to process.
        dir - The direction of the merge.
        Returns:
        A list of blocks after merging.

      • copy

        public Game copy()
        Creates a copy of the current game state.
        Returns:
        A new Game object with the same state as the current game.

      • getBlock

        public Block getBlock(int row,
                      int col)
        Retrieves the block at the specified position in the grid.
        Parameters:
        row - The row index of the block.
        col - The column index of the block.
        Returns:
        The block at the specified position, or null if the position is empty or invalid.

        public int getBlueScore()
        Returns:
        The current score of the BLUE player.

        public BColor getCurrentPlayer()
        Returns:

        Returns:
        A list of coordinates of empty tiles.

      • getGrid

        public Block[][] getGrid()
        Returns:
        The current state of the grid as a 2D array of blocks.

        Returns:

      • getTopWalls

        public java.util.Set<Coordinate> getTopWalls()
        Returns:
        The set of coordinates representing the top walls of the grid.

      • hasEmptySpace

        public boolean hasEmptySpace()
        Checks if there is any empty space in the grid.
        Returns:
        True if there is at least one empty space, false otherwise.

      • isTurn

        public boolean isTurn()
        Checks if it is the current player's turn.
        Returns:
        True if it is the current player's turn, false otherwise.

      • merge

        public void merge(Direction dir)
        Merges blocks in the given array. The blocks are merged from left to right. Elements will always be merged to the largest possible element.
        Parameters:
        dir - The direction in which to merge blocks.

      • nextPlayer

        public void nextPlayer()
        Switches the turn to the next player.

      • setBlock

        public void setBlock(int row,
                     int col,
                     Block block)
        Sets a block at the specified position in the grid.
        Parameters:
        row - The row index of the block.
        col - The column index of the block.
        block - The block to set.

      • setClient

        public void setClient(GameClient client)
        Sets the game client for this game instance.
        Parameters:
        client - The GameClient to associate with this game.

      • setCurrentPlayer

        public void setCurrentPlayer(BColor player)
        Sets the current player.
        Parameters:
        player - The color of the player to set as the current player.

      • setMyColor

        public void setMyColor(BColor color)

      • spawnRandomBlock

        public int[] spawnRandomBlock()
        Spawns a random block on the grid with a random value (2, 4, or 8).
        Returns:
        An array containing the row, column, and value of the spawned block.
